1.content:
Earth was on the verge of destruction during the mid-21st century; as global temperatures rose, water levels dropped and the atmosphere began to become toxic. Wars brought on by famine and hunger brought the population of 8 billion down to just over 100,000. Because of the limited resources, strict population control was put into effect – reproduction was based on a lottery system.

Things were looking grim for Humanity by the time an alien race called the Maltorians arrived. The advanced race was fleeing the destruction of their homeworld. They left their homeworld slightly more than 1000 years earlier, in 3 large colony ships. Each ship was sent to a different solar system to increase the chances the species would survive.

The Maltorians were surprised to find Earth that Earth was already inhabited, but they weren’t okay with the environmental damage. In exchange for land in South America, the Maltorians offered to help repair the planet. The repairs would take close to 30 years, so the remaining Human population was either placed in cryogenic sleep or sent to an underground settlement on the Moon.

Life on the moon was harsh; with a total of 30,000 Maltorians and Humans living in two large settlements in the Moon’s polar region. There was a near-constant need for repairs to the colony, the occasional food shortage and regular issues with life support. There were also the occasional flare-ups in inter-colonial relationships – but they were generally handled quickly.

This is where I enter the story. My name is Olivia and I was born in 2053; just over 4 years into the lunar exile. I live with my mom, dad and my little brother Eric in modest living quarters towards the outskirts of the colony. I was 5 years old when I contracted a potentially life-threatening disease; the cure for which was only provided by the Maltorians.
1.title: The Beginning

11.content:
June 10th, 2058
Lunar Colony

It was just after 8:00 in the morning when Mom and I walked through the security checkpoint leading to the inter-colonial rail system. The two of us were on our way to the Central Hub, where I was going to be dropped off at school.

As we stepped onto one of the transports, I took a seat between my mom and a window. The transport soon started to move and it wasn’t long before we were on the surface. I could see the tops of some nearby craters, but what really caught my eye was the Earth in the distance.

Now I’d been born on the Moon, so I had no real connection to Earth, but I knew that it was my ancestral home. Even at a young age, I knew how humanity had nearly destroyed the planet’s environment. My daddy said it would have become completely uninhabitable had the Maltorians not arrived when they did. I couldn’t see much detail since the night side was currently facing us, but I knew there was still work to be done.

As the transport continued on its journey, I spotted a young boy around my age. I immediately noticed that he wasn’t like other Maltorians that I’d seen around the colony. For starters, his skin was a lighter shade of blue and he had a full head of red hair. I was confused by that because I’d never seen a Maltorian with hair before.

My confusion faded when a bystander moved to the side, allowing me to see the human woman sitting next to him. Turning to look at Mom, I said, “Mommy, why does that boy have hair? I didn’t think Maltorians had hair?”

Looking up from her tablet, Mom glanced in the direction I was looking and said. “That little boy is only half-Maltorian; that woman sitting next to him is probably his mother.”

As I looked at them, I saw that no one was sitting next to them. “Why isn’t anyone sitting near them?”

“There are those that see children like him as pariahs; people to stay clear of.” Sighing, Mom said, “It’s really unfortunate because there’s nothing wrong with that young man. He didn’t ask to be born that way.”

Before my mom could stop me, I got up and made my way through the car to the boy. He looked up at me as I got closer. “H-Hi.”

“Hi. My name’s Olivia.” Smiling, I said, “What’s yours?”

The boy’s eyes lit up when I said that; it was clear few people took the time to talk with him. Looking at me, a smile appearing on his face, he said, “My name’s Kevin..”

I noticed the woman next to Kevin was looking at me. As I looked at her, I noticed a resemblance between them and figured she was most likely his mom. Turning my attention back to Kevin, I took a seat next to him and said, “How come I’ve never seen you around the school?”

“Children like me aren’t welcome in the main school; we’re seen as freaks.” On the verge of crying, Kevin said, “I go to a special school for other children like me.”

“I don’t think you’re a freak.” Smiling, I said, “It’s too bad you don’t go to my school; because I’d like to be your friend.”

“Really?” surprised, Kevin said, “Y-You’d want to be my friend?”

“Uh-huh!” pausing, I said, “In fact, how about you come over to my house tomorrow; we can play with my toys and watch some old cartoons.”

Kevin anxiously looked up at his mom who, despite looking concerned, nodded. A big smile on his face, Kevin turned back to me. Before I could stop him, he hugged me and said, “Thanks!”

The transport had arrived at the Central Hub at that point. While the other passengers left, some giving Kevin dirty looks, Mom walked over to where we were sitting. As I went to stand next to Mom, Kevin’s mom stood up and said, “You have a wonderful daughter, ma’am. I haven’t seen Kevin this happy in a long time.”

“Her father and I raised her not to judge people by their appearance.” Glancing down at Kevin, still with a smile on his face, Mom said, “She doesn’t care that your son in different; all she sees is another potential friend to play with.”

Doing something on her tablet, Kevin’s mom said, “I just sent you the relay code for my quarters. Give me a call, and we can set up the play date.”

“That sounds like a plan.” Taking my hand, Mom said, “Come Olivia, it’s time for school.”

“Okay.” Following after Mom, I looked back and waved at Kevin, “I’ll see you tomorrow, Kevin.”

Kevin smiled but cautiously waved back. “See you tomorrow, Olivia.”

As we walked of the transport station in the Central Hub, I spotted two Maltorians staring at me as I walked past. I noticed one of them say something to the other before they both nodded. I got an uneasy feeling as Mom and I continued walking. Little did I know, they’d started following us.
11.title: Continue

111.content:
I decided not to say anything to my mom about the men following us through the Hub. They walked past us when we reached the school, but one of them did glance at me as they walked by. It was at that point I started to feel a little nervous.

My nervousness must’ve been noticeable because Mom stopped outside the door and looked at me. “Olivia, honey, are you
alright?”

Looking up at her, I said, “I’m fine, Mommy.”

“I might be a little late picking you up this afternoon; I have to bring your brother for a checkup and your father has an extra shift.”

With that, the two of us walked inside the school and made our way to the Kindergarten area. As we rounded the corner, I spotted my friends Dhelo and Marcus putting some things in their cubbies. While Mom went to talk with Ms. Trogrik, probably about picking me up late, I ran over to my friends.

Dhelo, Marcus and I had known each other since we were 2 years old; our fathers worked together in the Colony Control Room. Dhelo was the oldest of the group; albeit only 2 weeks older than me.

Looking at me, Marcus said, “Are you alright, Olivia?”

Despite my best efforts, it seemed my concern about the men following me was still evident. Putting a smile on my face, I said,
“I’m fine.” As the three of us walked into the room, I said, “You guys want to play with the building blocks?”

After everyone agreed to the blocks, we made our way over to a viewport overlooking the lunar surface. As Marcus dumped the blocks on the floor, I noticed a few people in suits walking around on the surface nearby.

*****************************


It was just after 10:30 in the morning, which meant it was getting close to snack time. After playing with the blocks for almost an hour, the three of us moved on to simply staring out the window – occasionally waving at the workers if they saw us.

“Okay children, it’s time for snacks.”

I looked away from the viewport; only to get a sickening feeling in my stomach. One of the men from earlier was standing next to Ms. Trogrik. Seeing the disturbed look on my face, Dhelo said, “You okay?”

“That man was following my mommy and me this morning.”

“It’s probably just a coincidence.” Taking my hand, Dhelo said, “Come on, Marcus is saving us some seats.”

The next few minutes passed by without incident; Ms. Trogrik passed out some juice packets and some protein bars. When she got to me, I swear I saw a look of guilt on her face as she handed my snacks to me. I thought nothing of it, as I took a sip of the juice.

10 minutes had passed when I suddenly felt the worst pain I’d ever experienced. As I doubled over in pain, I noticed two other classmates in pain as well. Placing my hands on the floor to balance, I noticed they were starting to turn blue. {i+}What’s happening?

That was my last conscious thought before I blacked out. When I finally woke up again, I found myself ______.
111.title: At School

1111.content:
When I woke up again, I found myself in a room about the size of my bedroom. The beeping noises and the monitors around me told me I was in the Colony Medical Bay. I heard movement behind me and turned to find my parents standing at the foot of the bed, my brother Eric in Dad’s arms.

Mom was by my side the moment she noticed that I was awake. When she took my hand in hers, I immediately noticed that it was much bluer than it had been earlier. Pulling my hand back, I looked at it closer and said, “What’s wrong with my hand, Mommy?”

“We don’t know, sweetie; the doctor thinks it’s a Maltorian disease.” Pausing, Mom said, “We’re waiting for a Maltorian doctor to come and confirm.”

A look at my arms showed the changes weren’t limited to my hands – my arms were starting to turn blue as well. I was starting to get scared as I looked up at Mom. “What’s happening to me, Mommy?”

Tearing up, Mom said, “You’ll be alright, sweetie; I promise.”

It soon became apparent that my condition was too much for Mom to handle; as she quickly left the room. This elicited a response from Eric, “Mommy!”

Dad pulled a chair up to my bedside and said, “You’ll be back to normal soon, sweetie; don’t you worry about that.”

“Thanks Daddy.”

Looking at me, a curious look on his face, Eric said, “You look funny, Owivia.”

I wanted to say something in response, but Dad beat me to it. “Don’t say that, young man.”

*************************


While we waited for the Maltorian doctor to arrive, Daddy told me that three of my classmates had also been afflicted by whatever was affecting me. I asked if I could see them, but Daddy said the doctors were worried about spreading whatever this was to the rest of the colony. Mom had returned at that point, having composed herself. Walking into the room, she said, “How are you doing, sweetie?”

I had been feeling queasy for the last few minutes. Looking at Mom, I said, “My tummy hurts.”

Dad glanced at Mom and said, “I asked if we could give her something to settle her stomach, but the doctors advised against it.”

As Mom went to lie in bed with me, she looked around the room and said, “Where’s Eric?”

“Mrs. Carmichael came to get him about 15 minutes ago; I didn’t want to risk him getting whatever this is.”

“What about us?” running a hand through my hair, Mom said, “Shouldn’t we be worried about getting it ourselves?”

“I’m sure the doctors would’ve asked us to leave if they were worried about that.”

The Maltorian doctor, a woman in her mid 20s, walked into the room at that moment. “I’m sorry I’m late; you must be the Sheppard’s.” smiling, she reached out to shake Mom and Dad’s hands. “My name is Dr. D'Pkeni.”

“It’s a pleasure to meet you, Doctor.” Gesturing to me, Mom said, “Can you tell us what is happening to our daughter?”

Closing the door, Dr. D'Pkeni said, “900 years ago, after my species fled our home world, we realized that we weren’t adapted to living in space. A retrovirus was created to artificially alter our genome to ensure we could survive long-term space travel.” Sighing, Dr. D’Pkeni said, “I’m not sure how, but it seems your daughter was exposed to that retrovirus.”

I had no idea what any of that meant, but I could tell from my parent’s expressions that it wasn’t good. Taking my hand, Mom said, “What are you saying, Doctor?”

“What I’m saying, Mrs. Sheppard, is that your daughter is becoming a Maltorian.”

My eyes bugged out when I heard that; while my parents alternated between shock and anger. “You can fix this, right?” Looking at Dr. D’Pkeni, Dad said, “Please tell me you can make my daughter human again?”

“There is a way to counteract the changes, but I’m unsure as to the effect it will have on humans.” Taking a breath, Dr. D’Pkeni said, “There’s a very real chance that it could kill your daughter.”

I burst into tears when I heard that – I didn’t want to die. Tears streaming down my face, I looked at my parents and said, “I-I don’t want to die!”

While Mom tried to calm me down, Dad looked at Dr. D’Pkeni and said, “I’d appreciate if you watched what you said around my little girl.” Sighing, Dad said, “She’s scared enough already, she doesn’t need to be told she could die.”

“I-I’m sorry, Mr. Sheppard; it’s just that I’m not used to treating humans.” With a faint smile, Dr. D’Pkeni said, “I’m used to treating my own species, and Maltorians like to be told everything.”

I was still crying at that point, but not as much as before. Looking at my parents, and the doctor, I said, “What’s going to happen to me now?”

Mom and Dad looked at each other for a few moments; I knew they were facing an impossible decision. Either they continued to let me turn into a Maltorian, or risk the cure killing me. I knew I was only a child, but I knew the option I would have preferred – I’d rather be a Maltorian then dead.

While Dr. D’Pkeni stood by, and I sat on the bed, Mom and Dad discussed their options. After a moment, they took one glance at me before turning to Dr. D’Pkeni. Taking a deep breath, Dad said “_______.”
1111.title: The Medical Bay

11111.content:
“I think we’ll take the risk and try to cure her.”

I was dumbfounded by that answer; they would risk me dying in an attempt to make me human again. Looking at Dad, I said, “But Daddy, the doctor said it might kill me!”

“Everything is going to be alright, sweetie.” Looking at me, Dad said, “We’ll be here when you wake up.”

I was stunned into silence as Mom leaned over and kissed me on the forehead. “You’ve always been a strong girl; I know you’ll pull through this.”

I started crying at that point; fairly certain that I was going to die if the Maltorians attempted to reverse what was happening to me. Meanwhile, my parents, who I would have thought would fight for me, were seemingly okay with subjecting me to the risky procedure.
With all that, you could imagine my surprise when neither of them tried to comfort me.

Instead they simply assured me everything would be fine; while Dr. D’Pkeni returned with a needle full of a mysterious liquid. I tried to escape but it was fruitless; my parents left as Dr. D’Pkeni injected the liquid into my arm. The last thing I remembered before losing consciousness was seeing my parents disappear into thin air.
11111.title: Something's Not Right

111111.content:
When I woke up again, I quickly realized that my parents weren’t in the room with me. Since it was their idea to put me through this risky procedure, I would’ve thought they would be here when I woke up. Guess I was wrong.

As I sat in bed, wondering where my parents were, I became aware of a commotion out in the hall. I could hear an alarm going off in the distance – an alarm I knew meant the colony was on lockdown. When I moved to take the sheets off, I immediately noticed my skin was still blue – not only that, but my hands only had 4 fingers on them. That stupid cure didn’t even work!

Jumping out of bed, I ran over to a nearby mirror and my jaw dropped. The reflection looking back at me wasn’t the one I’d seen this morning. To my utter shock, I was now completely Maltorian; down to the 4 fingers, 4 toes and the dark blue eyes of the species. What is going on here?

Looking around the room, confused as to what was going on, I spotted a jumpsuit similar to the one I’d worn this morning. After getting dressed, I decided my next step was to make my way home. I slowly opened the door and peaked out into the hall; noticing everyone was running around in a panic.

I walked out of the room and started towards the exit; hoping that no one would stop me. Thankfully I made it to the exit without a problem, as everyone was in a panic. I made my way through the crowds to the transport hub; only then did I realize I didn’t have my transit pass. I wouldn’t be let on the transport without the pass, but I also needed to get home.

I spotted a Maltorian family getting on the transport so I decided to sneak on with them; hoping the guards would think I was with them. As the transport started moving towards home, I heard an announcement over the intercom. “A mandatory curfew will go into effect in 25 minutes; please return to your homes immediately. Anyone caught in the public areas after curfew will be punished.”

Hearing that announcement made me wonder what was going on. I’d never heard of anything like this happening before. Thankfully the transport arrived at the station without incident. After getting off, I saw I only had 20 minutes left to get home.

I ran through the central area to the passage that led to my family’s quarters. On the way, I saw some humans harassing a Maltorian woman; but didn’t stop to see why. Once I got to my family’s quarters, I started knocking frantically on the door.

“Mommy, open up!”

After a moment the door opened and I saw Mom standing there. She looked down at me with a confused look on her face. “Can I help you, little one? Are you lost?”

I was about to respond when I saw something that shocked me more than when I found out I was becoming a Maltorian. Behind Mom, walking out of my bedroom, I caught a glimpse of...myself.
111111.title: A Surprise

1111111.content:
Before I could even process what I was seeing before me, my Mom knelt down and repeated herself. “Sweetie, are you alright?”

It took a moment but I was finally able to compose myself. “What’s going on, Mommy?” glancing at my cop, I said, “I’m scared.”

Dad walked in from the kitchen, with Eric asleep in his arms. Moving closer to where my copy was standing, he said, “Catherine, what’s going on?”

“I don’t know, Michael.” Gesturing to me, Mom said, “This little girl must’ve been separated from her parents.”

“What are we going to do? The curfew starts in 15 minutes; she has to be in the Mal colony by then.”

I tried to speak again, to once again ask what was going on, but I was interrupted by my copy. She’d walked towards me and said,
“Don’t worry, my mommy and daddy will help you.”

Hearing her speak was too much for me; as my emotions got the better of me. My confusion over my parent’s willingness to risk my life, coupled with the fact there was another copy of me wearing my pajamas, was more than I could handle. Before I knew what was happening, I _____.
1111111.title: Confusion

11111111.content:
It took about 5 minutes for Mom to bring me to the Transport Station; all the while, I was trying to convince her that I was her daughter. As we waited in line, clearly getting annoyed at this point, Mom looked at me and said, “Sweetie, I understand you’re confused; but I’m you’re your mother.” Kneeling down to my level, she said, “That little girl you saw back there? She’s my daughter.”

“B-But...”

“I can understand if you were frightened about waking up without your parents.” With a smile, Mom said, “Hopefully they’ll understand when they see you again.”

Now it was my turn to be annoyed; was Mom always this stubborn? Why wouldn’t she even entertain the idea that I was telling the truth? Before I could try again to convince her, I was interrupted by the sound of someone talking in front of me. “Please sir, you have to let me on the transport.”

I looked up to find a woman in her late 20s standing in front of a guard. She looked to be in a panic about something. Looking at her, the guard said, “I’m sorry ma’am, but traffic to the Central Hub from this station is limited to Maltorians only.”

“You don’t understand!” digging through her bag, coming out with an ID card, she said, “My wife is Maltorian; please, I have to get home to her and my son.”

While the guard communicated with someone over the radio, my mom went up to the woman and said, “Excuse me, did you say your wife is Maltorian?”

“That’s right,” turning around, the woman said, “Don’t tell me, you disapprove of inter-species marriages.”

“No, of course not; my best friend is married to a Maltorian.” Gesturing to me, Mom said, “This little girl needs to get home to her family. Could she ride the transport with you?”

“Sure, I guess that’ll be alright.” Looking at me, the woman said, “Well, little one, what do you say we find your parents?”

I started to shake my head profusely; saying, “No, please, I don’t want to go! I belong here!”

The woman looked at Mom, who simply said, “I think she’s confused; she believes my husband and I are her parents.”

“You are!” looking at Mom, tears streaming down my face, I said, “Mommy, please believe me!”

Just then an announcement came over the intercom. “Lockdown will commence in 10 minutes; please return to your respective colonies at once.”

“I guess that’s our cue.” Grabbing my hand, the woman turned to my Mom said, “I’ll make sure she gets home safe and sound.”

“Thank you.” With a smile, Mom looked at me and said, “Stay safe little one.”

I could only watch, helpless to do anything, as Mom walked away. I yelled out to her, but to no avail. What’s going on here? The woman led me through the security area and we got on the last transport to the Maltorian Colony.
11111111.title: At the Transport Station

111111111.content:
The trip between the colonies took about 15 minutes; it was pretty uneventful. I sat silently by a window; fixated on my reflection and how much it had changed. I used to have my Daddy’s hair and my mommy’s eyes, but that wasn’t the case anymore. That was enough to bring a tear to my eyes, which caught the attention of the woman watching over me. Looking at me, she said, “Are you okay, sweetie?”

“No, I’m not.” Looking at her, struggling not to cry, I said, “I’m afraid I’m never going to see my parents again.”

“Don’t you worry about that; once we get off the transport, I’ll help you find your parents.” Taking my hand in hers, she said, “Who knows, they could be waiting for you at the station.”

I wanted to explain that she didn’t understand what was going on; but in reality, I didn’t fully understand it either. Would anyone believe me if I told them I was supposed to be a human girl? Realizing I should say something, I sighed and said, “I hope they’re there waiting.”

The two of us were silent for a few moments until the woman said. “You look to be around my son’s age.” With a smile, she said,
“How about, once we find your parents, we arrange a play date or something?”

“I guess so.” Pausing, I said, “Is your son Maltorian...like me?”

“No, he’s human like me.” Looking at me, she said, “I just realized I never introduced myself; my name is Liz.”

I wasn’t sure how to respond to that; Liz would probably be confused about why a Maltorian girl has a Human name. Thankfully an announcement came over the intercom before I could answer; announcing that the transport was arriving at the station.

As Liz was the only person I knew right now, I quickly grabbed her hand and followed her off the transport. Before we even got 10 feet, I heard a woman’s voice call out, “Liz, honey!”

The two of us turned in the direction the voice came from; I noticed a Maltorian woman walking towards us with a young Human boy. I quickly figured the boy was Liz’s son; and she was right, he did look about my age. I watched as Liz and the woman shared a kiss; before the woman turned noticed me standing there.

Seeing the quizzical look on her face, Liz said, “Don’t worry Sorain, this isn’t another mouth to feed.” Sighing, Liz said, “She was lost over in the Human Colony, I told the woman who found her that I’d make sure she got back to her family.”

“I was worried there for a second.” Chuckling, Sorain said, “With the lockdown, I’m concerned we don’t have enough food for the three of us; let alone another child.”

“It’s great to see how enthusiastic you are about us having another kid.” Sighing, Liz turned to me and said, “Sweetie, this is my wife Sorain and our son David.”

Sorain and I exchanged some quick pleasantries before I turned my attention to David. He looked to be about my height, maybe a little taller; with red hair and some freckles. He kind of reminded me of Marcus. Looking at him, I smiled and said, “Hi.”

“Hi.” Smiling back, David said, “What’s your name?”

“My name is...”

Before I could finish my sentence, I was interrupted by someone yelling out, “Matura Telfani!”

I looked around, thinking someone was looking for their child, only to spot _____ walking towards me.
111111111.title: The Maltorian Colony

1111111111.content:
I got a sinking feeling in my stomach as I noticed the couple rushing towards me; the woman looking relieved about something. “There you are, Matura; we were so worried about you.” Dropping to her knees, in front of me, the woman said, “Why did you leave the hospital?”

Out of fear, I stepped away from the woman; hiding behind Liz for safety. Looking at her, shaking my head, I said, “I-I don’t know you.”

“Matura, little one, we’re your parents.” Gesturing to the man behind her, she said, “We’ve been looking all over for you.”

“From the sound of it, she got herself lost in the Human Colony.” Pausing, Liz said, “Apparently she went to someone’s quarters; insisting that she was their daughter.”

“I’m afraid confusion is a common side effect with Phiemu fever; the humans should be glad they’re immune to the illness.” Sighing, the woman stood up and said, “Her sister found her sweating profusely in bed last night, so we rushed her to the Med Bay. The doctors were supposed to keep an eye on her, but with everything that’s happened; she was probably able to sneak out.”

That was the third time I’d heard someone mention something happening; I’d been too caught with my situation to figure out what it was. The woman reached out to take my hand, but I stepped away and looked up at Liz. “Please don’t let them take me; they’re not my parents.”

For a moment I thought I saw a glimpse of understanding in Liz’s eyes, but it quickly disappeared. “That’s enough Matura, your father and I have had enough of your games.” Forcibly grabbing my hand, the woman said, “Let this woman go home to her family.”

As the woman started pulling me away, Liz looked at me and said, “Bye Matura, it was nice meeting you.”

I tried to free myself from the woman’s grip as they led me from the station, but it was useless. As we walked through the main plaza, I decided my best course of action was to throw a tantrum. “Help! I’m being kidnapped; these aren’t my parents!”

Unfortunately, no one really paid attention; as the man and woman pulled me into a passageway. Reaching into his pocket, the man retrieved a needle. Looking at me, he said, “I was hoping this wouldn’t be necessary, but I’m afraid you leave me no choice.”

I tried to run but the woman had a grip on both my arms. The last thing I remembered, as the needle pierced my neck, was everything going black.
1111111111.title: My "Parents"

11111111111.content:
I wasn’t sure how long I was asleep, but when I woke up I found myself lying on a bed in an unfamiliar room. As I sat up in bed, the first thought that entered my mind was – how am I going to get back home?

I quickly looked around the room and saw another bed; with an assortment of toys strewn about the room. Wherever I was, this was definitely meant for children. Suddenly the door opened and I turned to see a young Maltorian girl, perhaps a few years older than me, walk into the room.

I reflexively squeezed myself into a corner and tried to cover myself with the covers; which caused the girl to stop and look back at my kidnappers standing in the doorway. The man simply gestured for the girl to go forward, saying, “It’s alright Tala, go introduce yourself.”

The girl, Tala, slowly walked forward until she was standing right at the foot of the bed. Looking at me, anxiety apparent on her face, she said, “Hi, I-I’m your sister Tala.”

“I don’t have a sister; I have a little brother.”

As soon as I said that, Tala started to tear up a little; which caused the woman to walk into the room. Tala wrapped herself around the woman, as she looked at me. “Matura, sweetie, the sooner you accept that we’re your family the better off you’ll be.”

“You aren’t my family!” getting defiant, I said, “I want to go home to my real family!”

Still wrapped around the woman, Tala looked up and said, “What’s wrong with Matura, Mommy?”

“Nothing’s wrong, sweetie; each conversion is different.” Looking for Tala to me, the woman said, “Your sister is just more strong-willed than we were led to believe.”

From behind them, the man said, “Either that or they picked the wrong child to convert.”

“Hush, Jervix.” Glancing back at the man, the woman said, “We just have to give her space; I’m certain she’ll come around in time.”

With that, Tala left the room with her parents; leaving me alone with my thoughts. Once the door was closed, I brought a hand to my mouth to keep from screaming. Whatever this conversion was, it was probably the reason why I was a Maltorian now. I don’t know what scared me more; the fact that this was intentional, or that I was specifically chosen.
11111111111.title: Waking Up

111111111111.content:
I sat on the bed for a while, listening to the conversation outside the door. The adults were clearly wondering what to do with me; as the man said, “We have to get her under control, Kalura; we can’t have her running off to the humans.”

“You don’t have to worry about that, Jervix.” Sighing, Kalura said, “With the entire colony on lock down after the attacks, there’s no way she’ll be able to communicate with her family.”

Attacks? Suddenly the door to the bedroom opened and Tala walked inside. Once the door was closed, she quickly walked over and sat on my bed. Looking at me, she said, “How are you doing?”

With a hint of annoyance in my voice, I said, “How do you think I’m doing?”

Tala recoiled at the tone of my voice, saying, “Sorry, I-I just thought I’d see how you were doing.”

It was at that moment I realized that Tala wasn’t responsible for my current situation. Instead she just mistakenly believed that I was her sister. I felt terrible when I saw Tala start tearing up. “I’m sorry if I upset you, Tala; but I’m not your sister.” Sighing, I said, “I wasn’t even born like this.”

What happened next was something I didn’t expect. “I wasn’t born this way either; the Maltorians kidnapped me a few years ago and made me one of them.” Looking at me, taking a deep breath, Tala said, “One minute I’m in the Central Plaza with my Mom; the next thing I know, I wake up and find out they’ve turned me into a Maltorian.”

“Did you ever try to get back to your family?”

“I tried to get back to them once; only...they were dead.” Tears in her eyes, Tala said, “They were killed, along with 14 others, when part of the passageway they were in decompressed.”

I had a vague memory of that incident; it had happened a few months after Eric was born when a micro-meteorite pierced the tunnel. Suddenly realizing my problem wasn’t nearly as bad as Tala’s problem, I embraced her and said, “I’m so sorry Tala.”

Tala held me close for a few moments as she cried. Once she was finished, she wiped her eyes and said, “I hate to say this, but I’m kind of glad to have someone else who knows what I’m going through. All my Maltorian friends think I was born like this, and I can’t tell my human friends because they think I’m dead.”

I chuckled a little bit; for I was also glad to have someone in my situation. “Do you know why they’re changing human children in Maltorians?”

“I have no idea; but whatever it is, it seems they need kids like us to do it.” Pausing, Tala said, “I have a feeling that clones were behind the attack on the Launch Zone.”

“What attack?”

“You don’t know about the attack?” shocked, Tala said, “One of the resupply ships heading to Earth exploded; killed 30 people.”

After hearing that, it made sense that the entire colony was put on lockdown. Unfortunately for me, that was going to make it difficult for me to get back to my family. It was at that moment that the door opened again and Kalura walked stepped into the room. “I'm glad to see my girls are getting to know each other." with a smile, she said, "Dinner will be ready in a few minutes; why don't you girls get washed up."
111111111111.title: Talking with Tala

1111111111111.content:
Tala led me to the bathroom; where the two of us washed our hands. I looked at Tala, sitting on the toilet, as I dried my hands. “What does Maltorian food taste like?”

“Don’t worry; the food is actually pretty good.” Standing up, Tala said, “I have to ask; have you ever noticed that you never see Maltorians eating?”

I’d always wondered why Dhelo and my other Maltorian classmates ate in a different room for lunch. Looking at Tala, I said, “I never really thought about it, but you’re right. Why is that?”

“It’s out of respect for the humans.” Moving to unzip her jumper, Tala said, “Maltorians don’t wear any clothes when we eat.”
I instinctively went to cover myself; even though I was still fully clothed. “Nothing at all?”

“Not even underwear.” Pulling the jumper down from her shoulders, Tala said, “I thought I’d better tell you before we left the bathroom.”

I quickly realized I had no way out of this; so I reluctantly took my clothes off as well. Once the two of us were completely naked, we walked out of the bathroom and joined Kalura and Jervix at the table. “Good Tala, you told your little sister about our custom.” Looking at me, Kalura said, “Don’t worry, Matura, you’ll soon grow accustomed to our ways. Given time you’ll even forget ever doing it anyway but ours.”

I silently took a seat at the table next to Tala; as Kalura said some words in Maltorian. Once she was finished, Jervix gave us permission to start eating. I kept my eyes on my plate at first; not wanting to see anyone, myself included, naked. But as dinner continued, I found myself gazing around the table. Kalura was right, I was getting used to it.
1111111111111.title: A Dinner Surprise

11111111111111.content:
After dinner, I was allowed to play. However, I didn't have any of my favorite toys; those were all back at my real home, with my real family, being played with by a fake me.

Instead, I had to play with Maltorian toys. Some of them were kind of fun, though. The Maltorian dolls were a lot like my Barbies. I had a bunch of them sitting around and drinking nekta juice, and Kalura smiled and nodded. For a moment, I almost forgot that I was her prisoner, along with Tala.

After an hour of playing, Kalura said it was time to get ready for bed. My nightgown was a lot like the one I used to wear. The stuffed animal was weird, though: Instead of a teddy bear, it was something with tentacles.

After I had time to get ready for bed, Kalura came into the room I shared with Tala and tucked me in. "I know this must all be scary for you, Matura," she said, "but you don't have anything to worry about. I will not allow any harm to come to either of you. You are safe with me."

"You're not my real mother!" I said. "You took me away from my family, and left a fake in my place! If you wanted a kid, why didn't you just do this to the fake?"

Kalura didn't say anything at first. When she did say something, she just said, "I will die before I allow anyone to harm you, Matura." Then she picked up a book and read me a Maltorian story until I fell asleep.
11111111111111.title: After Dinner (Locked)

11112.content:
“We’d rather see our little girl as a Maltorian; then risk losing her.” Looking at Dr. D’Pkeni, Dad said, “Are you certain that she’ll be alright?”

“Yes, Mr. Sheppard, I’m sure.” Nodding, Dr. D’Pkeni said, “Your daughter will be just fine.”

“Then it’s settled.” Smiling, Mom said, “We’ll have a Maltorian daughter, and we’ll be proud of her.”

After my encounter with Kevin on the transport, and learning about the stigma he deals with, I was relieved to hear that. Whatever happened to me after this, my family would still be there. There was, however, something I wanted to check out.
“Mommy. Daddy. Can I have some privacy?”

“Of course, sweetie.”

Mom and Dad left the room with Dr. D’Pkeni. Once I was alone, I removed my covers to find my feet were as blue as my hands. As I climbed out of bed, I noticed that the little finger on each hand was curled up and I couldn’t straighten them out. I knew Maltorians only had four fingers on their hands, so I figured I would lose those soon.

Walking over to a mirror I saw my forearms and lower legs were blue; while my upper arms and thighs were slowly changing.
Thankfully Maltorians were roughly the same size as humans, so I knew that wouldn’t change; while the shape of my head wouldn’t change until I was older. I was going to be different from my family, but maybe not so much.

As I turned to go back to bed, I saw some of my hair lying on the pillow. While hybrids like Kevin generally kept their hair, full-blood Maltorians were bald. So it wasn’t surprising to find that I was losing my hair; just like I was losing two of my fingers and two of my toes.

Climbing back into bed, I remembered Dr. D’Pkeni saying that I’d been exposed to whatever changed me. As I lay in bed, I remembered the two Maltorians following me this morning. Where they responsible for this? I wondered. Why did they do it? And why did they pick me?
11112.title: We Won't Risk It

111121.content:
When I woke up the next morning I found that my arms and legs were now completely blue. The change in color was already spreading over my body and creeping up my neck. A glance in the mirror showed that my eyes were starting to turn blue.

I was almost completely bald by this point; with a large amount of hair resting on my pillow. All that was enough to bring a tear to my eyes; before all this, I had my daddy’s hair and my mommy’s eyes.

*********************************


Apart from a visit by my folks and Eric, my morning consisted of a series of examinations to ensure that I was healthy. I overheard one of the nurses saying that one of my kidneys had completely disappeared while the other had moved to where my stomach should have been.

After all the examinations were finished, I was brought to a small play area where I saw two other children playing. Looking at them, I saw they were going through the same changes as me. Walking to them, I said, “Hi, my name’s Olivia.”

“I’m Bethany.” Pointing to the boy next to her, the girl said, “This is Todd.”

As I sat down next to them, I said, “How are you guys doing with this?”

“I guess I’m doing okay.” Sighing, Todd said, “I’d just like to know why this is happening to me...I mean us.”

I hadn’t told my parents about the Maltorians following me yesterday, but I had a feeling they had something to do with what was happening. “I saw two Maltorians following me yesterday; I bet they had something to do with this.”

“Do you think they’ll ever let us out of here?”

“Sure.” Pausing, Bethany said, “Once we're done changing."

“At least I’ll be going home once that happens; my parents said they’re going to raise me as a Maltorian.” Sighing, I said, “The doctor said she had a way to cure me; but when they heard it could kill me, they said no.”

“My mommies said the same thing.”

“My Daddy wanted to do it." Todd said. “But my mommy was able to talk him out of it.”
111121.title: Meeting the Others

1111211.content:
I got plenty of visits from Mommy and Daddy while I changed. Eric came with a few times, as well. Whenever he came, he told me, "You wook funny."I

And I said, pretending I was scared, "Oh, no! I'm turning into you!"

Finally, I was done changing. Nobody who saw me would ever think I was ever a human. I was a Maltorian now.

But Mommy and Daddy still loved me. They brought me clean clothes to wear, then the doctor said I could go home.

I walked out of the hospital, holding Eric's hand. "You hand feel funny," he said.

"You'll get used to it," I told him.

When we got home, there was a Maltorian woman waiting at the door. "Did I get here too early? I'm sorry," she said. Turning to me, she said, "My name is Sorain. You must be Olivia. I hope we'll be friends."

"Sorain is going to teach us about Maltorian culture," Mommy said. "Since it's your culture now, Olivia, you should know about it, and we'll learn along with you."

"Are we the first humans you've taught?" Daddy asked.

"Hardly. My wife, Liz, was first." Turning back to me, she said, "We have a little human boy, about your age. I think he'd like to meet you. Would you like to meet him?"

I smiled. "Maybe."
1111211.title: Going Home as a Maltorian

11112111.content:
I went back to school the next day. Mommy dropped me off, like she always did. Apparently, everyone heard about what happened to me and the others, because Dhelo walked right up to me and asked if I was me.

"Yes, it's me," I said.

"Are you okay?"

"I'm getting used to seeing a Maltorian in the mirror. Mommy and Daddy hired somebody to teach me Maltorian stuff, so I can fit in better."

Marcus figured out which one of the new Maltorians was me because Dhelo was with me. I made another new friend, too: a human boy named David. He told me that he had two mommies, one human and one Maltorian. I asked if they were Sorain and Liz, and they were. So I got to meet him before Sorain could introduce us.

The school day went like it did before, until lunch. Then, I was brought into the Maltorian eating area with Dhelo.

"How come the Maltorian kids don't get to eat with the rest of us?" Marcus asked.

"Because Maltorians take off their clothes when we eat," Dhelo replied.

It was the truth: Once the door was shut, we all took off our clothes. That was one Maltorian custom that Mommy and Daddy opted not to join me in.
11112111.title: Back to School

111121111.content:
Mommy picked me up after school as she said she would. As we walked to the transport station, ignoring the quizzical looks from others, Mommy said, “How was school today, sweetie?”

“It was interesting.” Looking at her, I said, “I’d always wondered where Dhelo and the others went after lunch; now I know. We had religious services where we prayed to the Goddess Chrestus.”

“I see.” Curious, Mommy said, “What was that like?”

“It was interesting; although I couldn’t really understand it because the priest was speaking Maltorian.”

“I’m sure we can help you with that.” As we got on board the transport, Mommy said, “I spoke with Kevin’s mother on the way here; she’s going to meet us at the house. I explained to her what happened, but I don’t know if she told Kevin.”

“I hope he still wants to be friends with me.”

As the transport started moving, Mommy said, “I’m sure he will; especially since you were so kind to him.”

The ride was uneventful, although Mommy and I did get quite a few curious looks – no doubt wondering why I was with a human woman. Once we got off the transport, we walked through the plaza to the elevator; riding it up 3 floors to our level.

As we rounded the corner by our quarters, I saw Kevin and his mommy standing outside the door. She saw me almost immediately, but Kevin was fixated on his tablet. I cautiously walked up to him and said, “Hi Kevin.”
111121111.title: After School

1111211111.content:
"Hi, Olivia," Kevin said, slowly looking up. "Your voice sounds - " And then he saw me. "Why do you look like that?"

"I changed," I replied. "Dr. D'pkeni said it was a Maltorian retrovirus that I somehow got exposed to. It happened to two other kids, too. How do I look?"

"You look good," he said. "Before, I thought I looked funny next to you because of my hands and face. Now, I look funny because of my hair."

"You don't look funny," I told him. "You look like you, and nobody else can do that."

Kevin's mommy sighed with relief. "They're still hitting it off," she said to Mommy. "How is everybody dealing with it?"

"We're getting through this stage," Mommy said. "We're all learning about Maltorian culture. The Maltorian language is next, so Olivia can understand what they're saying at services. But I've caught more than one human staring at us."

"Trust me," Kevin's mommy said, "it's worse when they start speaking to you. Not a day goes by without someone asking me, 'Don't you think they should be left with their own kind?' I guess gratitude can't beat bigotry."

"Well , let them say what they want," Mommy said. "Olivia is our daughter. We love her, no matter what she looks like. And nothing will ever change that."
1111211111.title: Reactions

11112111111.content:
On the morning of my 13th birthday, I looked at myself in the mirror. My breasts weren't much to look at, but the shape of my head showed that I would soon be a Maltorian woman.

Mom knocked on the door, then came in. "Olivia, honey - "

I gave her a look.

"Sorry," she said. "Matura, honey, breakfast is ready. I made your favorite."

I smiled. Mom and Dad weren't great shakes at much of Maltorian culture, but Mom's Maltorian cooking brought praise even from my Maltorian friends. I took off the dress I was wearing, then joined the family at the table. I offered prayers to Chrestus, and then the meal began.

After breakfast, it was usually Eric's and my job to do the dishes. Today, though, Dad decided to join me.

As we washed, it became clear why. "Ol- Matura, sorry - about your name,... "

"Matura is a prophetess, Daddy," I explained.

"I know that," he replied. "It's just that... What was wrong with Olivia?"

"Nothing. Olivia is a nice human name. But I'm not a human, and I haven't been for eight years."

"Are you ashamed of us?"

I turned to him, unsure if I had heard him correctly. "What have I done to suggest such a thing? Tell me, so I can correct it."

"Well, your name,... "

I understood now. "My name is Matura Sheppard, Daddy. My first name tells everyone who I am, and my last name tells them where I came from. I am not an Olivia, Daddy, but I will always be a Sheppard. I know that Chrestus smiles upon this home, and I would never dishonor her or you by wishing for another."

Dad wiped tears from his eyes. "That's all I needed to hear. And know that Chrestus smiles on you, too. Your mother and I gave you the other name, and perhaps we were foolishly bound to it. We have always said that we love you, no matter what. I apologize for suggesting that might not be the case."
11112111111.title: 8 Years Later

111121111111.content:
It was just after noon when my friends started to arrive; my human friends gave me hugs, while Dhelo and the other Maltorians greeted me by interlocking their fingers with mine and touching their foreheads to mine.

A big smile appeared on my face when Kevin arrived; something which Dhelo noticed straight away. Pulling me aside, she said, “Judging by that smile, I suspect you’ve made your decision?”

When a Maltorian female reaches her 13th birthday, she’s allowed to give herself physically to a person of her choosing. My parents weren’t too keen about that idea; especially after Sorain mentioned it involved sex. But once they realized that it was part of my culture, they relented and gave their consent. “I spent days praying to Chrestus for her guidance.” Turning my attention back to Dhelo, I said, “I’ve decided that Kevin is the one I want to be with; if he’ll have me.”

“I think it’s pretty obvious what that answer is going to be.” Chuckling, Dhelo said, “He’s been following you around for weeks.”

Dhelo and I were still talking when Mom came over to us; carrying two glasses of nekta juice. “Matura, sweetheart, don’t forget you have other guests here as well.”

“Yes, mother.” Taking one of the glasses, I said, “Dhelo and I were just discussing my plans for this evening.”

“I’d appreciate it if you didn’t discuss that in public.” Sighing, Mom said, “I’m aware that it is part of your culture, but I’m afraid the parents of your human classmates might not understand it.”

“It’s not my fault your species has such primitive hang-ups when it comes to sexuality.”

“I’m not saying it...you know what, I’m not going to get into another argument with you about this.” Taking a deep breath, Mom said, “Just enjoy your party, then you can spend the evening doing whatever you want with Kevin.”

“Will you keep it down, Mother!” gritting my teeth, I said, “I haven’t discussed it with him yet!”

“Well, you may want to before it’s too late.” Pointing behind me, Mom said, “He seems to be having a nice conversation with your friend Madison.”

Turning around, I saw Kevin talking with Madison Decker; a girl from my lacrosse team. We were on friendly terms, but the two of us tended to be competitive with each other. I already lost out on being Team Captain; I wasn’t going to let her take Kevin from me. Handing my drink to Dhelo, I took a deep breath and walked over to them. “Sorry to interrupt; but Kevin, could I talk to you for a moment? In private?
111121111111.title: My Birthday Party

1111211111111.content:
I led Kevin into my room; where we could have some privacy. As we sat down on my bed, Kevin looked at me and said, “What did you want to talk about?”

It was as though my resolve had suddenly left me. I started to wonder why Kevin would want me when Madison was much more appealing. Chrestus, I prayed, move through my voice. Taking a deep breath, I looked at Kevin and said, “Kevin, I would like to perform the rite of val'asho with you tonight.”

Kevin said nothing for what seemed like an eternity. Then he closed his eyes, bowed his head and said, “I am humbled.”

I was overjoyed at his acceptance, my hearts leaping in my chest. I clasped Kevin’s hands in mine and touched my forehead to his. "I'm so happy.” smiling, I said, “I was terribly afraid Madison would have asked you first.”

“She did, but I turned her down.” Chuckling, Kevin said, “I believe she phrased it, ‘You know that sex thing you guys do when you turn 13? Can I get in on that?’”

I closed my eyes and shook my head. “There are so few humans who understand our ways.”

“But they can change, just look at you.” Smiling, Kevin said, “It’s just that we ask very little of them.”

Kevin did have a point. After all, if I were still human then my family and I wouldn’t have tried so hard to understand Maltorian culture. Clasping hands and touching foreheads again, the two of us rejoined the party.

I waited an appropriate length of time before telling Dhelo; but decided to let Madison figure it out for herself. I think she got the idea when Kevin didn’t leave once the party was over.
1111211111111.title: Alone with Kevin

11112111111111.content:
Kevin and I bade everyone goodnight, then we closed my bedroom door behind us. It was time to perform the rite of val'asho.

I lit incense, then we disrobed. As Kevin had eaten over before, this wasn't the first time I'd seen him naked, but it meant so much more now.

I anointed my body with the sacred oil, offering my prayers to Chrestus. Kevin did likewise. The oil was sweet-smelling, and it stimulated our bodies.

Approaching each other, we explored each other's bodies with our hands, blessing each other as we went. Then, Kevin donned the sacred prophylactic. The time for children was for later, not tonight.

I began kissing him first, all over his body. The oil had a pleasant taste that aroused me further. When I finished kissing, he began kissing me, all over.

Finally, we climbed into bed, and, with one more prayer to Chrestus, our bodies became one.

I knew that we had performed the rite of val'asho correctly, because I felt Chrestus within me and all around me.
11112111111111.title: The Rite of Val'asho

111121111111111.content:
I went back to school on Monday, but things were different. I noticed more people staring at me than before. I couldn't figure out why, since, other than my head attaining its full womanly shape, I looked the same as before val'asho.

At school, I noticed my friend, Tara, wasn't there. She hadn't been at my party, either. I asked a mutual friend, "Where's Tara?"

"As if you didn't know," was the cold reply.

When I saw Dhelo again, I asked her. "I don't know, either," she replied. "It isn't just her. Johnny's out, too. And, when I asked, I was treated like I did it."

When Madison came along, I asked her, "Have you seen Tara? Or Johnny?"

"I heard they're in the hospital," she replied. "Them and a bunch of others. They're turning into Maltorians."

That sent chills down my spine. "Do you think I should go visit them?"

"I wouldn't recommend that, Matura," Madison cautioned. "A lot of people are blaming Maltorians for it."

"But I know what they're going through! After all, I used to be human, too!"

"Emphasis on used to be," Madison said. "Don't expect a lot of humans to want to hang out with you."

She was right. David was still willing to be seen with us, but Marcus was suddenly avoiding us.
111121111111111.title: Back to School

1111211111111111.content:
I texted Marcus, inviting him to my apartment after school, but he didn't text back. I had always liked Marcus: the last thing I wanted was for our friendship to end.

As the day went on, I learned that twenty children were becoming Maltorians. I asked one of the teachers if there were something I could do for them. "Didn't you do enough?" asked one of the human students.

It was with heavy hearts that we sat down to lunch in the cafeteria. But Chrestus wants us to see the positive, and it was good to sit with Bethany and Todd again. They had avoided me after I announced that I would be using a Maltorian name from now on.

"They're mad at us, too," Bethany said. "They should know we had nothing to do with it."

"The fires of hate make a smoke that clouds the mind and closes the eye," Dhelo quoted.

"What should we do if they do something against us?" Todd asked. "Should we get back at them?"

"The prophetess whose name I have taken," I told him, "tells us that killing a murderer does not alter the number of murderers. Chrestus calls us to love."

"I'll give it a shot," Todd said. "But, if it doesn't work, Dad's got a gun. It may not change the number of murderers on the moon, but it'll change the number of murderers looking to kill us."

I questioned Todd's math, but said nothing for the moment.
1111211111111111.title: Learning More

11112111111111111.content:
"How was school, Matura?" Mom asked me when I got home.

"Chrestus calls us to see the positive," I replied. "But it's not an easy task today."

Mom put on some milky tea for me. "Want to talk about it?"

"Twenty of my human classmates are becoming Maltorians. And the other humans blame the Maltorians, myself included." I took a breath. "Mom, I think Marcus may be among the ones who blame me."

Mom gave me the tea. "Marcus has known you for your whole life, Matura. He can't possibly have forgotten about that. Maybe he just needs a little time to sort out everything he's hearing. People are like that sometimes."

"How do you know that's what he'll do?"

"I don't, honey," she said with a smile. "I just wanted to help you to see the positive. Finish your tea."

The tea was good, as always, and its warmth eased my dismal mood.

Eric came in. "You okay, sis?" he asked.

"I take it you heard?"

"It's all anybody talks about today." He sat down next to me. "They're mad at me, 'cause I've got a Maltorian sister."

I put my arm around him. "They're mad at you because the fires of hate have made a smoke. It's clouding their minds and closing their eyes. Chrestus will guide them, if they seek the truth again."

Eric looked at me. "You know I don't believe in Chrestus, right?"

"That's okay, little brother. She believes in you."
11112111111111111.title: At Home

111121111111111112.content:
"Matura, honey," Mom said, "you have a guest."

My tea finished, I put the cup in the dishwasher and went to see who it was.

"Marcus!" I ran right over and hugged him. "I don't know why you avoided me, but I'm glad you're here now."

"Matura," he said, slowly pronouncing each syllable, "I need to know. I need to hear it from you: Did you do anything to those kids?"

"What? No!" Did he really doubt me?

"Do you know who did?"

"Are you accusing me, Marcus? If you are, say it to my face, now."

"I'm not accusing you," he said. It's just... You've been acting strange. You're not the Olivia I knew anymore."

"You know that I was changed into a Maltorian, myself. I am proud of who and what I am now. But do you really believe that I would force another to do what I have done? Such a thing goes against everything in the Xrex'yrd, Marcus. It would dishonor me in Chrestus's eyes. Do you really think that of me?"

He lowered his head. "I... guess I don't sound like much of a friend."

"But there is hope, Marcus: You came to me with your concerns. You didn't just assume you knew everything and join those who said those horrible things." I took a deep breath. "If what happened to those kids was deliberate, then maybe what happened to me was deliberate, too. Maybe I was a victim. But why?"

Marcus shrugged. "Maybe they want humans to become Maltorians. Maybe they think it will accomplish something, like those people who blew up buildings back on Earth."

I shook my head. "Whoever is responsible has struck against the Maltorians as much as the humans, even if they don't realize it. They must be stopped." I turned to Marcus. "And I think it will take the human and Maltorian governments working together to do it."

"The human government may not want to work with the Maltorians."

"So how can we show them that they must?"
111121111111111112.title: Marcus

1111211111111111121.content:
I could feel the eyes upon me as Marcus and I entered City Hall. After all, few Maltorians took interest in human politics, and even fewer who were not yet adults. And I'm sure there's only one name on the list of Maltorian students who walked into City Hall in the company of a human boy and said, "We would like to speak with the mayor."

The mayor of New Hope was a very busy man, and he would be the first to remind anyone of that fact, let alone a 13-year-old Maltorian girl. So it was no surprise that we were initially dismissed.

"We have an idea regarding the children who were turned into Maltorians," I said, reaching over to hold down the intercom button.

Dad had always told me there was a difference between a busy person and a person who talks about being busy: If you offer to take some of the work, a busy person will turn you down, while a person who talks about being busy will jump at the chance. This, he said, was because a busy person wants things done right, while the person who talks about being busy would rather do nothing at all.

Which type of person was the mayor? I'll give you a hint: when two 13-year-olds offered a solution to a problem that affected 20 families, the mayor said, "You've got five minutes."
1111211111111111121.title: Making a Plan

11112111111111111211.content:
"So," the mayor said, "let's hear your plan."

"In order to find who is responsible for turning humans into Maltorians," I explained, "you need to work hand in hand with the Maltorians."

"Why would I do that?"

"Whoever's behind this is doing it deliberately," Marcus replied. "Maybe even to drive a wedge between the races. If we're going to stop them, we need to do the last thing they want us to do: work together."

"And why should I listen to you?"

"Because it happened to me already," I answered. "I was one of the human children who became Maltorians eight years ago. I believe it was done as a test, to see what the reaction would be."

"And what was that?"

"I've embraced being a Maltorian. Another has a foot in both communities. And the third has been raised as a four-fingered blue human with two hearts and no hair. None of us have been rejected by our families. Whoever did it may want more information. This may be only Phase II of their plan."

"And what would Phase III be?"

"I don't know. It's up to whatever their goal is. But they definitely don't want the two governments joining forces."

"Why wouldn't they want the Maltorians looking for them? Wouldn't they be thrilled?"

"To Maltorians, the laws of government and Chrestus are one. And they know that their actions are forbidden under the Xrex'yrd. They would face not only our judgment, but Chrestus's. It's not a glass of nekta juice that awaits them."

The mayor was silent for a long time.
11112111111111111211.title: Meeting the Mayor

choices: I tell mom what I saw.
I keep it a secret, for now.
113.content:
School was like any other day there. Very few students due to there being so few of us humans left. We each had a tutor at our side, walking us through our classes but there was little interaction permitted. In fact, each teacher wore a medical mask and gloves to prevent the spreading of germs. All precautions including social distancing was ordered to keep the next generation safe from illness. We were all told that we were humanity's hope to carry on. No pressure there, right...

"You are excel in all subjects, Olivia." Smiling, my teacher, Mrs. Jones said. "You have finished today's lessons early so you are dismissed."

I smiled at that and gladly left my desk, thoroughly washing my hands before leaving the small school building. As I walked to the trans pick up to return to the transport station in the Central Hub, I noticed two blurry men watching me from a distance. They were both Maltorian and not a friendly looking pair. I picked up the pace, hoping the human only trans would be there when I arrived. It did not help my nerves to know that they had started to follow me. "What did I do to get their interest?" Worried, I thought. "I'm just going home."

I moved even faster and arrived at the trans pick up just as it had arrived. i almost literally jumped on and showed the driver my DNA ID, proving I was true blood human. The driver nodded and motioned me to take a seat. I did so and looked out the window to the frowning faces of the two Maltorian men. One took up a small radio device as the trans moved away from the school. "Those blasted Maltorian security goons seem to be everywhere these days." Grumbling, the driver said. "Any idea why they were interested in you, lass?"

I shook my head. "Not a clue." Honestly, I replied.

"Keep your senses sharp, lass." Frowning, the driver said. "There is too few of us to have your youngins disappear."

I nodded then turned to the window at the passing scenery. There was not much to see as we were in a colony on the moon but it was something to look at. Just as boredom was about to set in, a second trans going the other way stopped as mine did only a few feet away. I looked over and nearly screamed. Staring right back at me, in complete disbelief was a little girl who looked exactly like me!

For a moment, we just stared at each other as if looking at a reflection until the two trans continued on their way...
113.title: After School

1131.content:
Upon arriving at the Hub, I found mommy waiting for me. She was smiling until she saw the tears in my eyes as I ran right for her. "Olivia... what's wrong?" Concerned, she demanded. "You're shaking like a leaf!"

"Mommy... mirror people are real!" Crying, I wailed. "I saw another who looks just like me, I mean just like me!"

Mommy sighed then gave me a patient smile. "I think you have been pushing yourself too hard trying to be the best at all things." Loud enough to be heard by others, she said. "You are ahead in your studies so I see no harm in starting your weekend a day early."

She placed her hand onto my forehead and her expression turned to great concern. "Honey, you are burning up... do you feel faint?"

"I'm scared, mommy..." Sobbing, I said. "I know what I saw was real."

Mommy knotted her jaws, as she did when she had made up her mind in something. "I'm taking you to the hospital wing straight away." Firmly, she said. "You are ill."

I tried to protest but once mommy made up her mind, nothing could change it, not even dad. She took me back to the Central Hub and pulled me onto the trans. "Hospital wing." Firmly, she barked. "My daughter is very ill with fever."

The driver nodded and pressed a button near the driving console. a glass section of the bus marked Quarantine opened. Mom pulled me into the section and sat down with me before the door was sealed. We remained in that sealed glass section until we reached the hospital wing. As the tans moved along, i was in for another shock. I saw a another girl who looked a lot like mommy only she was a little younger than me!

"Maybe I am sick..." Gulping, I thought.
1131.title: I tell mom what I saw.

choices: I wake up in a strange place.
11312.content:
As we were moving along the tram to the hospital wing, Mommy seemed to be becoming more and more worried. "Mommy, what's wrong...?" Softly, I asked.

"This is not the route to the hospital." Worried, mommy replied. "We're being taken to the quarantine sector."

"The what...?" Startled, I asked.

Mommy sighed. "It is where they take the very sick." Patiently, she explained.

Shortly after, the trans stopped and two women in hazard environment suits hurried on and opened the quarantine section. "Please, Mrs Sheppard..." Calmly, the first woman said. "Your safety and the safety of your daughter is very important to us."

"What's going on?" Frightened, I demanded.

"We just want to make sure you and your mommy are okay." Smiling, the second woman said. "There is a very bad cold going around."

Though I did not fully understand, I nodded and we were quickly led off the trans into the quarantine sector. Upon being led in, a team of people in white coats ushered mommy and I onto a cot and we were rushed into a room together. There was so much activity in the room, I could not follow it all and it was frightening me... I began to cry until I felt a sting in my arm and was instantly plunged into darkness...
11312.title: Quarantined!

113121.content:
My eyes slowly flickered open and I found myself lying in a simple but comfortable bed in a small, barren room. I sat up, feeling dizzy, due to whatever had hit me and took a careful look around. Behind me was a large window, over looking a small but inviting court yard. To my left was a sizable mirror, taking up almost a quarter of the wall. On the right was a door, leading to a tiny wash room. Across the room from me was a closed door, I guessed was the only way out. My memories of what had happened the night before were still fresh in my mind but, for some unknown reason, I was strangely unafraid, merely confused.

“Where am I?”

I crawled out of the bed and discovered that I was now wearing a fashionable pair of blue pajamas. Upon closer examination of myself, I found that I was carefully bandaged from head to foot, making me look somewhat like a mummy, only increasing my confusion.

“What happened to me?”

I looked down at my feet and found a pair of pink slippers, which I slipped on, then walked uneasily to the closed door. Of course, the door was locked. But, still in a daze, I was not detoured and pulled onto the door knob harder. The lock broke with a low crunch and the door handle ripped off in my hand as the door slowly drifted open in front of me. I looked at the handle, slightly surprised, then lightly dropped it to the floor as I then cautiously walked out into the hall.

“He- Hello?” Politely, I called. “I- I’m sorry about the door. Hello?”

I looked around as no one answered and began to slowly wander the halls, curiously taking yin my new environment, uncertain, but not afraid. “Hello? Is anyone here?”

"My but you are a strong girl." Startling me, a voice said.

I spun around to find a well dressed, tall and attractive young woman, standing in the hall. She smiled politely and motioned for me to follow her. Seeing no threat, I walked over to her. "Where am I?" Politely, I asked.

"You are in a safe place, I am Dr. Dani Dorsey." Calmly, the woman replied. "I do apologize for your injuries, there was a fight over you before we could get you here."

"A what...?!" Startled, I thought. Then i asked, "Have you seen my mommy?"

"All in due time, young lady." Kindly. Dr. Dorsey said. "Your mother is safe and resting. I was hoping we could have a little talk... won't you join me for some tea...?"
113121.title: I wake up in a strange place.

12.title: Character Profiles

info.brief_description: Problems are bound to occur when aliens and humans live together
info.description:
The Maltorians arrived on Earth in the mid 2040s; looking for a new world to settle after fleeing their home system. What they found was a planet on the verge of destruction; thanks to humanity causing irreversible damage to the environment. The Maltorians offered to use their advanced technology to repair the planet - the catch was that it would take 25 years to do so.

In the meantime, the Maltorians and the remaining humans would live in a colony on the Moon. The humans believed the Maltorians were their saviors, but they didn't know the Maltorians were hiding something from them - something that would have devastating consequences for humanity.

Rules:
1. Use proper grammar
2. Be creative with storylines but keep close to the original idea.
3. Use the 1st person perspective (I, I'll, I'm, etc) - as the story will be from Olivia's POV.
4. I reserve the right to edit, and/or/ remove chapters.
